body.p: Your Petitioner Tho. J. Hansel respectfully represents that at the March Term 1859 ^of the Rockcastle Circuit Court^ he was find the sum of $20. on a charge of Gaming the truth is he was in a a game of cards for amusement alone so far as he was concerned he bet nothing there ^was^ betting by by standers. at the time but there was no ^bet^ between one him & the man he played against & not ^no^ betting on the man he was opposed to.; at the trial however it was proved that ^there^ was betting on the game & he was consequently fined He states that he never followed gambling of any kind, nor has ^he^ ever played cards since. He is a poor man with a small family & his wife is a cripple & he can not pay the fine without great injury to him & his little family.
Where fore he prays a remission of the fine

Respectfully your
Petitioner
Tho J Hansel
Sworn to before me this 10. Aug 1861

H. Moore
E T. Fish
D. G. Colyer clk
Lewis S Smith
F. B. McClary
W. B. Smith
G W Payne
Wm Payne J, R, C
E T. Fish, c, P. c. c
J. Newcum
Chas. Whitaker
Daniel Roberts Cor, R, C
Alfred, Smith
Gov Magoffin. dear Sir I hope that you will remit this fine

yousr respt
Granville Pearl
A. J. Moore

$20. } Gaming
Tho. J. Hansel
Issd Sept 4 1861
